alert.note: Alert for Cass; Logan; Mason; McLean; Menard; Morgan; Sangamon; Scott; Tazewell; Woodford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 9:24PM CST until January 10 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, highest near the Illinois River. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph Tuesday night. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Illinois, generally between the Illinois River and I-55. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Much of the accumulating snow will occur before sunrise Tuesday, with mostly rain Tuesday morning into early afternoon. This period of rain could cause some of the snow on the ground to melt before the second round moves through later Tuesday afternoon into evening, making total accumulations appear to be less. Around an inch of snow is expected from the latter round.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com
